verses.verse: My <S%H1121>son<s%>, <S%H7181>attend<s%> unto my <S%H2451>wisdom<s%>, and <S%H5186>bow<s%> thine <S%H241>ear<s%> to my <S%H8394>understanding<s%>:
That thou mayest <S%H8104>regard<s%> <S%H4209>discretion<s%>, and that thy <S%H8193>lips<s%> may <S%H5341>keep<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge<s%>.
¶ For the <S%H8193>lips<s%> of a strange <S%H2114>woman<s%> <S%H5197>drop<s%> as an <S%H5317>honeycomb<s%>, and her <S%H2441>mouth<s%> is <S%H2509>smoother<s%> than <S%H8081>oil<s%>:
But her <S%H319>end<s%> is <S%H4751>bitter<s%> as <S%H3939>wormwood<s%>, <S%H2299>sharp<s%> as a <S%H6310>twoedged<s%> <S%H2719>sword<s%>.
Her <S%H7272>feet<s%> go <S%H3381>down<s%> to <S%H4194>death<s%>; her <S%H6806>steps<s%> take <S%H8551>hold<s%> on <S%H7585>hell<s%>.
Lest thou shouldest <S%H6424>ponder<s%> the <S%H734>path<s%> of <S%H2416>life<s%>, her <S%H4570>ways<s%> are <S%H5128>moveable<s%>, that thou canst not <S%H3045>know<s%> them.
<S%H8085>Hear<s%> me now therefore, O ye <S%H1121>children<s%>, and <S%H5493>depart<s%> not from the <S%H561>words<s%> of my <S%H6310>mouth<s%>.
<S%H7368>Remove<s%> thy <S%H1870>way<s%> <S%H7368>far<s%> from her, and come not <S%H7126>nigh<s%> the <S%H6607>door<s%> of her <S%H1004>house<s%>:
Lest thou <S%H5414>give<s%> thine <S%H1935>honour<s%> unto <S%H312>others<s%>, and thy <S%H8141>years<s%> unto the <S%H394>cruel<s%>:
Lest <S%H2114>strangers<s%> be <S%H7646>filled<s%> with thy <S%H3581>wealth<s%>; and thy <S%H6089>labours<s%> be in the <S%H1004>house<s%> of a <S%H5237>stranger<s%>;
And thou <S%H5098>mourn<s%> at the <S%H319>last<s%>, when thy <S%H1320>flesh<s%> and thy <S%H7607>body<s%> are <S%H3615>consumed<s%>,
And <S%H559>say<s%>, How have I <S%H8130>hated<s%> <S%H4148>instruction<s%>, and my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H5006>despised<s%> <S%H8433>reproof<s%>;
And have not <S%H8085>obeyed<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H3384>teachers<s%>, nor <S%H5186>inclined<s%> mine <S%H241>ear<s%> to them that <S%H3925>instructed<s%> me!
I was <S%H4592>almost<s%> in all <S%H7451>evil<s%> in the <S%H8432>midst<s%> of the <S%H6951>congregation<s%> and <S%H5712>assembly<s%>.
¶ <S%H8354>Drink<s%> <S%H4325>waters<s%> out of thine own <S%H953>cistern<s%>, and running <S%H5140>waters<s%> out <S%H8432>of<s%> thine own <S%H875>well<s%>.
Let thy <S%H4599>fountains<s%> be <S%H6327>dispersed<s%> <S%H2351>abroad<s%>, and <S%H6388>rivers<s%> of <S%H4325>waters<s%> in the <S%H7339>streets<s%>.
Let them be only thine own, and not <S%H2114>strangers'<s%> with thee.
Let thy <S%H4726>fountain<s%> be <S%H1288>blessed<s%>: and <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> with the <S%H802>wife<s%> of thy <S%H5271>youth<s%>.

Let her be as the <S%H158>loving<s%> <S%H365>hind<s%> and <S%H2580>pleasant<s%> <S%H3280>roe<s%>; let her <S%H1717>breasts<s%> <S%H7301>satisfy<s%> thee at all <S%H6256>times<s%>; and be thou <S%H7686>ravished<s%> <S%H8548>always<s%> with her <S%H160>love<s%>.
And why wilt thou, my <S%H1121>son<s%>, be <S%H7686>ravished<s%> with a strange <S%H2114>woman<s%>, and <S%H2263>embrace<s%> the <S%H2436>bosom<s%> of a <S%H5237>stranger<s%>?
For the <S%H1870>ways<s%> of <S%H376>man<s%> are <S%H5227>before<s%> the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and he <S%H6424>pondereth<s%> all his <S%H4570>goings<s%>.
¶ His own <S%H5771>iniquities<s%> shall <S%H3920>take<s%> the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> himself, and he shall be <S%H8551>holden<s%> with the <S%H2256>cords<s%> of his <S%H2403>sins<s%>.
He shall <S%H4191>die<s%> without <S%H4148>instruction<s%>; and in the <S%H7230>greatness<s%> of his <S%H200>folly<s%> he shall go <S%H7686>astray<s%>.
